subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_007B_01C9D9EB.72EFA620
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yes...I know.... but it is fun to fantasize. Plus, if I am in a position to=
 make a difference I will. The problem is knowing when or where that positi=
on is.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Kristin Morris 
  To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 7:56 AM
  Subject: RE: [=
EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?






  We can't police th=
e entire internet.  People should take responsibility for themselves and do=
 some research and find out how this works before they purchase.  

  Cavea=
t emptor..  




----------------------------------------------------------=
--------------------

  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
  Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 8=
:45 AM
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auct=
ion for sorta Frank's Box?








  Exactly! That's what I'm sayin'.



  =
Wouldn't it be a hoot if Frank himself blasted the guy. But that isn't the =
mature way..... ;)



    ----- Original Message ----- 

    From: threadsi=
ntyme@... 

    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

    Sent: Thursday, May =
21, 2009 5:52 AM

    Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fra=
nk's Box?



    Why don't some of us respond to his ad...and take serious =
issue with this business of his lying to the public about Frank? 

    That=
 info is a serious breach of eBay policy. He could be banned from eBay for =
life. 
    Al
    ---------- Original Message ----------
    From: "Kristin=
 Morris" <ckmorris95@...>
    To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
    S=
ubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
    Date: Thu=
, 21 May 2009 06:16:27 -0500

    WOW.. Frank.  I didn't realize you were c=
harging - and "thousands of dollars" to boot!  Must be to pay for that Fara=
day Cage and the white noise generator thing this yahoo believes are in all=
 your creations.  And hurry because "his supplier" (cough - cough Radio Sha=
ck) is discontinuing!  But no worries he has "sold over 2 dozen of these 'F=
rank's Boxes devices" so he must be legit because he knows - and actual cus=
tomer bought a 'real' Frank's Box and said it was equal!  Awesome.

    k

=

--------------------------------------------------------------------------=
--

    From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On B=
ehalf Of ourobouros2k2
    Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 12:50 AM
    To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.com
    Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fra=
nk's Box?







    Been following this unprofessional idiot's items for a=
while now. I love how he says that Frank charges thousands of dollars for a=
n original Frank's box. 

    This dude is the worst type of con, preying o=
n people who know only enough to be familiar with the term Frank's box. The=
n again, it always has bothered me when people take shack hacks and charge =
stupid prices for them on ebay under the Frank's box moniker.

    This guy=
 is based out of Nevada I believe, and his group's ethics leave little to b=
e desired. Takes all kinds, I reckon...

    Andy

    --- In EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com, Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote:
    >
    > Hmmm... saw this on E=
bay tonight... you've got to read all the text to hear
    > how he describ=
es what he's selling. 
    > 
    > Do any of you on this list know who he =
is? I just thought this was kind of
    > interesting... see:
    > 
    > =
http://tinyurl.com/o5pper
    > 
    > Cheers,
    > 
    > Leslie, consist=
ent lurker and occasional poster <g>
    > 
    > "I'm not happy, I'm cheer=
ful. There's a difference. A happy woman has no
    > cares at all. A cheer=
ful woman has cares but has learned how to deal with them."
    > 
    > --=
 Beverly Sills (1929-) American Opera Singer
    >



    _________________=

or only $3.95/mo. Free setup!
